original_title: Sri Lanka’s NTB Bank net up 15-pct in  Dec quarter
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Profits at Sri Lanka’s Nations Trust Bank said December 2022 quarter net profit rose 15 per cent to 1.9 billion rupees from a year ago helped by net interest income growth, despite the higher provisions for bad loans.

Interest income grew a fast 129 percent to 17.4 billion rupees from 7.6 billion a year ago and interest expense grew by 139 percent to 8.5 billion resulting in the Net interest income to increase by 121 percent to 8.8 billion rupees from 4 billion rupees.
Earnings per share were 6.06 rupees for the quarter and 22.61 for the first twelve months.
“Interest rate movement and margin expansion during the year resulted in strong Revenue growth of 67 percent,” the bank said in its interim report.
Provisions for bad loans increased by 192 3.6 billion rupees from 1.2 billion rupees a year earlier.

“Gains in Operating Income were negated to some extent by the sharp rise in Impairments. The Bank’s impairment provisions relating to loans, advances and sovereign bonds, rose 270 percent Year on Year,”
“Provisions were impacted by negative flows from moratorium loans and the overall deterioration in credit quality across most loan portfolios due to the weak economic environment.”
Total assets of NTB 9 percent to 414 billion rupees from 379.5 billion rupees a year earlier.   (Colombo/Feb24/2016)
